thread.title: Teenage lesbian couple say they had to leave McDonald's | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Teenage lesbian couple say they had to leave McDonald's | Daily Mail Online

author: Thomas Burrows For Mailonline
title: Teenage lesbian couple say they had to leave McDonald's | Daily Mail Online
text: Teenage lesbian couple say they were forced to leave McDonald's restaurant after cleaner said their kissing 'wasn't appropriate' Kristeen Ferenczi, 16, said she felt pressured to leave McDonald's in Bolton Claimed a cleaner said her kissing her 17-year-old girlfriend was 'inappropriate' She said they were made to feel 'awful' and both started crying afterwards McDonald's have now launched an internal investigation into the incident Published: 01:49 GMT, 13 February 2017 | Updated: 01:50 GMT, 13 February 2017 8 shares comments Kristeen Ferenczi, 16, said she felt pressured to leave McDonald's after kissing her girlfriend on the cheek in the restaurant A teenage lesbian couple claim they were told to leave McDonald's after a cleaner said their kissing 'wasn't appropriate'. Kristeen Ferenczi, 16, said she felt pressured to leave the fast food outlet in Bolton town centre after she kissed her 17-year-old girlfriend on the cheek. She said they were made to 'feel awful' and both started crying following the incident. McDonald's have now launched an internal investigation. The couple had been eating in the restaurant at around 12.30pm on February 9 when they were approached by the cleaner. Kristeen, who lives in Farnworth, told the Manchester Evening News: 'We were sitting down with my girlfriend and my girlfriend's cousin having a meal. 'When he got up to go I noticed this woman just lingering around us, and as I kissed my girlfriend on the cheek she came over and told us it wasn't appropriate, and implied for us to leave. 'I turned round and said "are you homophobic?" but she wouldn't answer. 'You see a lot worse in McDonald's, there was nothing inappropriate about us kissing on the cheek. RELATED ARTICLES
